page.title: 11FARMING IN TODDINGTON AREA
page.content: The major feature of our area is{ {arable farming.}The heavy clay soil dictates winter wheat, winter barley and oilseed rape. These crops occupy over 75% of the area. Smaller areas of grass are largely on the steeper fields around Toddington Hill. The{ {livestock farming}is nearly all fattening cattle for beef. These are purchased as calves, fed grass the first summer and then fattened in yards during winter feeding silage, hay and barley. There are small numbers of ewes and lambs. One large farm covers 25% of our area. They employ 1 worker for every 300 acres and farm large fields with a high degree of mechanisation. This contrasts sharply with small family farms with only the owner as worker. The less intensive family farm disturbs the{natural environment}less.
